The boundary movement patterns show consistent intent: one segment describes a straight fixed route south-southeast (lat(t) ≈ 54.5207 - 0.0063 × t), and the other a gently curving path with slowly varying COG and stable heading. The gap occurs between these two, transitioning from linear to slightly curved navigation. vb_8377157303611993086 matches this transitional behavior with its gradual and consistent course change (COG from 48.4° to 50.4°), stable speed, and steady heading (55°–57°), indicating controlled navigation along a mildly curvilinear route—consistent with a vessel adjusting its trajectory within a structured traffic zone. The parametric model of position progression (Δlat ≈ k·Δlong with k ≈ 0.7–0.8) aligns with the geographic trend observed in the incomplete AIS samples, which show a smooth south-southeasterly drift in latitude and longitude, supporting continuity in both direction and kinematic stability.
'''
